result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Death

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Undraius Broussard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Undraius Broussard appeared by video.  Attorney Angel L Johnson appeared by video for Undraius Broussard.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer W. Hanney. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 12. 

*Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Arraignment scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Undraius Broussard appeared by video.  Attorney Angel L Johnson appeared by video for Undraius Broussard.  Attorney Chad Wozniak appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not available until 3pm. Defense has a plea and sentencing to attend at 3pm. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Undraius Broussard in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Undraius Broussard appeared by video means.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense unable to appear, in trial for the morning. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Defendant Undraius Broussard in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court or in the alternative that it be set for status of counsel; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Undraius Broussard in court with Student Intern Simon Earle under the supervision of attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-28-2022 @1p
